title: When Media Censorship Only Runs One Way
sub_head: You’ve chosen to interpret recent actions by social-media and technology companies as a “progressive purge.” Another view is that these private companies are doing exactly what they believe is in the best interest of their corporations and their shareholders.
body:
Regarding your editorial “The Progressive Purge Begins” (Jan. 11): President Xi Jinping of the Chinese Communist Party shuts down Google, Facebook and Twitter in China, blocking information to 1.4 billion people. Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey closes the sitting president’s account, blocking information to his 88 million direct followers plus countless others via redistribution. Amazon blocks books based on their authors’ political viewpoint. Google and Apple block Parler. Twitter blocked the New York Post, though they later relented. What master are they serving?
Has House Speaker Nancy Pelosi considered that President Trump’s 88 million Twitter followers is a larger group than the 81 million-plus Joe Biden voters?
Bill Ragsdale
Woodland, Calif.
